intro: Cacalia diantha, commonly known as the white thistle or white cudweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in early summer, often arranged in clusters. Its leaves are typically lobed and covered in fine hairs, and the plant grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils. Cacalia diantha is often found in meadows and along roadsides, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
